text: Barbara Cook, an iconic Broadway actress and singer, died at 89 years old on Aug. 8 from respiratory failure. Josh Groban and more stars have taken to Twitter to mourn the legend — see their heartfelt messages here. Broadway legend Barbara Cook, who starred in The Music Man, She Loves Me, Candide and many more musicals, died today, Aug. 8, at her home in New York City. The community has quickly offered their condolences, with Josh Groban, Lea Salonga and more stars tweeting. “ A friend. A mentor. A master.
